comments:
This warning does not make any sense to me.

It appears on a Servlet 2.3 dynamic web project on JRE 1.4.2_08, Tomcat 4.1, WTP
0.7 RC2 and Ubuntu Hoary Linux.
This bug is still present on 0.7 final

Andreas, can you attach any relevant bits from your workspace's .metadata/.log
file to help us debug this?  Doesn't Tomcat require a full JDK as well?

Ted, any idea what could cause this?

I am able to create the same error on Windows XP using JDK 1.5.0_04, Tomcat 5.5,
and WTP 0.7. I'm attaching a screenshot of what I did in order to create it. For
me it was linking an external folder that contains a JSP that uses a taglib (for
the test case I used JSTL core). You should be able to reproduce it using the
screenshot as a guide.

Created an attachment (id=27084)
screenshot of a project setup that creates the IWAE0010E warning

Apologies, my message was "JSP Syntax Validator", not "JSPEL Validator". I still got the same 
NullPointerException with same "message thrown was ."

I'm able to reproduce the key seems to be a jsp in a linked in directory.  The 
stack trace produced is:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.JSPTranslator.addTaglibVariables
(JSPTranslator.java:627)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.JSPTranslator.translateXMLNode
(JSPTranslator.java:866)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.JSPTranslator.translateRegionContainer
(JSPTranslator.java:783)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.JSPTranslator.translate
(JSPTranslator.java:680)
at 
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.JSPTranslationAdapter.getJSPTranslation
(JSPTranslationAdapter.java:132)
at 
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.search.JSPSearchDocument.getJSPTranslatio
n(JSPSearchDocument.java:112)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.search.JSPSearchDocument.getPath
(JSPSearchDocument.java:149)
.........

There seems to be a typo at JSPTranslator.java:627.  Currently the two lines 
there read:

if(f == null && f.exists())
   return;

This is almost certainly not what was intended.  This will, of course, NPE 
whenever f is null.

Phil -- I can keep looking but, if you feel like it, you won't hurt my 
feelings. ;-)

Part of a mass update. Based on 9/22/2005 development review meeting, it's 
determined this was an open bug/enhancement with tartget mistakenly set to M8. 
Since this will not be in M8, I am changing to "unspecified". 

If this is an error, please correct (for example the bug really has been fixed
in M8, change back to M8, and "fixed".)
